org.rdkit.knime.util

Class RDKitAdapterCellSupport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rdkit.knime.util.RDKitAdapterCellSupport

  • public final class RDKitAdapterCellSupport
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines for the RDKit, which data types are compatible with each other and what type converters exist. It is used to provide automatically type conversions for RDKit Nodes whenever necessary.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RDKitAdapterCellSupport.DataCellTypeConverterFactory
      Interface to be implemented when converters register for adapter cell support.

      • getConverterFactory

        public static final RDKitAdapterCellSupport.DataCellTypeConverterFactory getConverterFactory(java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> targetValueClass)
        Returns the registered converter factory of the specified target value class.
        Parameters:
        targetValueClass - Target value class.
        Returns:
        Converter factory or null, if not found.

      • getAdaptableValueClasses

        public static final java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>[] getAdaptableValueClasses(java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> targetValueClass)
        Returns an array of adaptable value classes. An adaptable value class can be converted into the specified target value class.
        Parameters:
        targetValueClass - Target value class.
        Returns:
        Array of adaptable value classes for the specified target value class or null, if not found.

      • canBeConverted

        public static boolean canBeConverted(DataTableSpec tableSpec,
                                     int columnIndex,
                                     java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> targetValueClass)
        Checks if values of the specific column in a table can be converted into the specified target value class.
        Parameters:
        tableSpec - The input table's spec. Can be null.
        columnIndex - the index of the column that should be checked.
        Returns:
        True, if data type of the column can be converted into target value class and if the value target class is not already the preferred data value class of the data type. False otherwise.
        See Also:
        canBeConverted(DataType, Class)

      • canBeConverted

        public static boolean canBeConverted(DataType dataTypeSource,
                                     java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> targetValueClass)
        Checks if values of the specified data type can be converted into the specified value class.
        Parameters:
        dataTypeSource - Source data type to check conversion for. Can be null.
        targetValueClass - Target data value class. Can be null.
        Returns:
        True, if data type can be converted into target value class and if the value target class is not already the preferred data value class of the data type. False otherwise.

      • createConverter

        public static DataCellTypeConverter createConverter(InputDataInfo inputDataInfo,
                                                    java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> targetValueClass)
        Creates a new converter for a specific column in a table. The output type and the specific converter that is used is determined automatically from the input type.
        Parameters:
        inputDataInfo - Input data info that describes the column that is subject of conversion.
        Returns:
        A new converter or null, if no converter available.
        See Also:
        createConverter(DataType, Class)

      • createConverter

        public static DataCellTypeConverter createConverter(DataTableSpec tableSpec,
                                                    int columnIndex,
                                                    java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> targetValueClass)
        Creates a new converter for a specific column in a table. The output type and the specific converter that is used is determined automatically from the input type.
        Parameters:
        tableSpec - the input table's spec
        columnIndex - the index of the column that should be converted.
        Returns:
        A new converter or null, if no converter available.
        See Also:
        createConverter(DataType, Class)

      • createConverter

        public static DataCellTypeConverter createConverter(DataType type,
                                                    java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> targetValueClass)
        Creates a new converter for a specific source type and the specified target value class.
        Parameters:
        type - Source type that needs to be converted. Must not be null.
        targetValueClass - Target value class that the converter shall deliver as part of an adapter cell.
        Returns:
        A new converter or null, if no converter available.

      • expandByAdaptableTypes

        public static java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>[] expandByAdaptableTypes(java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> valueClass)
        Returns an array of acceptable value classes with the same class as passed in, plus additionally all classes that are adaptable to it.
        Parameters:
        valueClass - Original value class. Can be null to return null.
        Returns:
        New extended array or null, if null was passed in.

      • expandByAdaptableTypes

        public static java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>[] expandByAdaptableTypes(java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>[] arrValueClasses)
        Returns an array of acceptable value classes with the same classes as passed in, plus additionally all classes that are adaptable to it.
        Parameters:
        arrValueClasses - Original value class array. Can be null to return null.
        Returns:
        New extended array or null, if null was passed in.

      • expandByAdaptableTypes

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>> expandByAdaptableTypes(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue>> listValueClasses)
        Returns a list of acceptable value classes with the same classes as passed in, plus additionally all classes that are adaptable to it
        Parameters:
        listValueClasses - Original value class array. Can be null to return null.
        Returns:
        New extended array or null, if null was passed in.

      • expandByAdaptableTypes

        public static ColumnFilter expandByAdaptableTypes(ColumnFilter columnFilter,
                                                  DataType... arrTargetType)
        Returns a column filter which accepts the same types as the passed in filter, plus additionally it accepts types that are adaptable to the specified target types.
        Parameters:
        columnFilter - Original column filter. Can be null to return null.
        Returns:
        New extended column filter or null, if null was passed in.
